content.p: The content of this page is help for using Geonetwork. It is not intended as a help guide for editors or administrators. That can be found xxx.
Metadata Catalogue offers a simple and advanced search.

The simple search allows you to search on the following fields:
Title
Abstract
Keywords
Location
Free text (any metadata field)
Note - Keywords are not case sensitive.
How to search: Enter the word(s) you want to search on in the ‘What?’ search box (top left) and click 'Search’. Results will display in alphabetical order.
To view the metadata record click on the title. The full metadata record will open.
To begin a new search click on the ‘Home’ link (top left).

Select advanced search tab and enter words you want to search in the 'What?' search box and click 'Search' , the results will display in title order.
You can also search by categories. Click on a category from the Categories list. All records within that category will display in alphabetical order.
The data themes section shows all records within an environmental theme. Every record sits in the most relevant theme. Records may sit under more than one theme.
The recent changes section shows the 10 most recently updated records.
If you want to add a record to name of solution please email metadata@environment-agency.gov.uk When we know who our editors are we can list them here and expand this section.

Records can be saved and exported and links emailed and book-marked.
Note – these records contain personal information. Please do not share externally.

This functionality is for when you want to share or re-use a metadata record with others.
This can be done in numerous ways:
Save the file as ISO 19139 xml
Save the file as DublinCore xml
Save the record as a pdf
These can be done as individual records or by selecting many.
Select the record(s) you want to save and in ‘actions on selection’ choose one of the options.
This functionality allows you to send an email with the metadata records unique ID. Click the envelope icon (top left).
This functionality shows the metadata records full URL which includes the unique ID. Click the star icon (top left).

Metadata records must not be deleted. We keep all records for historic purposes. There is the functionality for administrators to retire records but these would need good reason - define what this is or link to process/guidance.

p.ul:
Definitions of dataset, data series, data services, spatial and published. These are all terms within our metadata.
Dataset - A dataset is a defined collection of digital data, typically a list or table of facts, which is held, extracted or formatted for a specific business purpose.
Data Series - Data Collection of datasets sharing the same product specification
Data Services - An interface that allows the delivery of the data via the Internet be it either a view, feature or invoke service.
Spatial - A dataset that is spatially referenced and stored as a GIS or Geomatic file format such as .shp, .tab, WMS, ASCII etc.
Published - A dataset that has been proactively disseminated and is available via a recognised Data Sharing Platform service and discoverable by metadata.
